item.title: Time to Move to HD Video Cameras
item.description: The familiar sound of “Taps” softly playing from your TV symbolizes the end of an era: analog television. From its start with Herbert Hoover to its abrupt conclusion, marked by TV stations switching off their analog transmitters, this technology has reached its end. The outdated 4:3 video format should disappear alongside it, but strangely, it’s still present. Observe TV broadcasts throughout the day, and you’ll find many programs, including network shows and local news, still framed by black bars on the sides.
